intro: Noccaea cochleariformis, commonly known as the kidney-shaped stonecrop, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves that are kidney-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Noccaea cochleariformis is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to grow in arid conditions.
